newsitem.title: UK: LIFFE cocoa nudges higher as stg eases.
newsitem.headline: LIFFE cocoa nudges higher as stg eases.

text.p: London cocoa futures crept up at Wednesday's close on light trade and industry buying as sterling stepped down from the peaks.

Traders said a weaker sterling in currency markets eased pressure from origins and attracted some industry offtake against a background of improving technical sentiment after failure to dip below 975..
But volume was considered mediocre at a total 2,769 lots. "Sterling fell back a bit so there is less hedging pressure but there is hardly anything convincing," said one trader.
The benchmark March erased losses incurred in early session and clawed higher to end four stg up on the day at 989 stg while front-month December rose three stg to end at 960.
Traders were getting impatient with Ivorian arrivals with no headlines on Wednesday as to when the season would start.
The Commodity Minister Guy-Alain Gauze said earlier this week that the official season would begin on Wednesday or Thursday. But farm and freight rates are yet to be fixed.
Switches were steady with Dec/March at 28 and 26 stg, March/May and May/July stood at 15 and 13.
March is expected to encounter stiff resistance at 1,000 stg before making headway toward the crucial 1,025 level. But support is strong at 975.
